**Digital Business Capability Strategic Assurance Consultant Services**
### Tender Announcement

#### Request for Abbreviated Proposals

The Department of National Defence (DND), through Defence Construction Canada (DCC), invites professional service providers to submit an Abbreviated Proposal for the provision of strategic assurance consultant services for the Digital Business Capability (DBC) initiative.

#### Background

The DDBC aims to implement a digital transformation strategy, and Defence Construction Canada requires consulting services to ensure that the initiative meets industry standards and requirements.

#### Scope of Work

Selected consultants will provide the following services:

- Third-party, independent guidance and recommendations on industry standard approaches and digital transformation trends and technologies.
- Project reviews at various stages, including quarterly assurance assessments, milestone readiness assessments, and post-implementation assessments.

#### Evaluation Criteria

Proposals will be evaluated on the established criteria in the Request for Abbreviated Proposal (RFAP) documents. The objective is to select the proponent with the highest total score.

#### Solicitation Documents

All solicitation documents can be accessed on the MERX Electronic Bidding System. Proponents can log in and access the RFAP.

#### Imprtant Dates

*   Publication date: 2022-09-14
*   Closing date: 2022-10-24T14:00:00
*   Contact information for additional details or clarification: amanda.eid@dcc-cdc.gc.ca, 343-540-6713

#### Project Budget

The total budget for this contract is $500,000.00.

#### Notice of Interest to Participate

Firms that consider themselves qualified to provide the required services are invited to submit their Abbreviated Proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System on or before the closing date and time indicated.

#### Additional Information

Contract award results and further information can be found on the DCC website at [Contract Activity - Defence Construction Canada (dcc-cdc.gc.ca)](http://dcc-cdc.gc.ca).
